website_summaries.verdict: Many people were able to appreciate the Nike Air Max Sequent 3. They believed that this neutral running shoe delivered comfort and style in a single package. Runners and casual shoe enthusiasts alike were even appreciative of its apparently high-quality construction, as well as the relatively inexpensive price. On the other hand, there were those who thought that it was narrow while some had complaints about the construction of the underfoot platform. Nevertheless, the Sequent 3 was deemed a worthy successor to a relatively fresh yet well-regarded series.
pros: The design of the Nike Air Max Sequent 3 appealed to many consumers who wanted style and functionality in a single package
Several testers observed that the weight was suitably light
The underfoot cushioning system gained favor for being comfortable and responsive
Some purchasers stated that the price was affordable
The durability of this model was lauded
many people deemed the construction to be of high quality
cons: Some people noted that the Nike Air Max Sequent 3 was too narrow
The platform apparently had a raised arch that caused some discomfort, according to a reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but beware--are much smaller than your normal size. Order 1/2 to full size larger
customer_reviews.text: Shoe for me, was one size too small. I normally take a 10, and took a 10.5 because of other reviewers stating that this shoe was smaller than normal. Unfortunately for me, it was a full size too small. Had to return it, but it was not available in 11 from anyone on Amazon. Had to get it elsewhere. Luckily for me, I found it for slightly less plus free shipping! Once I received an 11, the shoe fit perfectly, is very comfortable, and i love the look of it. Shoe is also very lightweight. Four stars for the look, feel, and design, but am deducting one star because they are so much smaller than what is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Popped air cushion.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in the end of July. I walk, not speed walking, I just walk, I severed my achilles in January and I still walk at a snails pace. They fit well, but the quality is obviously not there at Nike anymore. I have never had an air cushion pop. I have owned Air Max for many many years this has never happened. I bought from amazon so it seems I have no recourse for replacement. I am not the only one it seems that has had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these shoes. I’ve bought three pairs over the past year... they look awesome, however they are very tight in both width and toe area. It is manageable but it feels like I’m wearing a 9 1/2 when I purchased and wear a 10 1/2. The biggest problem is the air sacks. They literally pop or bust within a month on moderate use. Each pair I’ve had did this and I only wore them for walking, no running or training. It’s a shame because they look great and the cushioning is great... for a month until the air pocket busts.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes about 2 months ago. I didn't really do much in these shoes. The toe area on the right shoe started to fray and eventually devoloped into a hole. Also, I only went running once in these shoes & the air bubble popped on the right shoe. I had high expectations & am very disappointed in the craftsmanship of these "running" shoes. Steep price for crappy shoes with 1 month past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These shoes were definitely worn before they were sent to me
customer_reviews.text: I will attach pictures... I have collected shoes for years and never had a brand new pair come creased like this... pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Runs small/narrow but comfy and stylish when you figure out what size and how to wear them
customer_reviews.text: These run a little narrow and I don't think they offer wide sizes. I've kept the laces loose so they fit. Really comfortable though once you figure out how to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Kouki_Boss

customer_reviews.title: Air leaks and sole collapses into air pocket
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very comfortable, but started leaking air within a few months. Within 6 months the sole is collapsing into the air pocket. See pictures. Currently checking into having these exchanged under Nike's 2 year warranty. Will update as this progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen B.

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is a after market shoe but they don’t last and they are tight on your sides
customer_reviews.author: Tony cushman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I go running and walking a lot and decided to purchase these nikes, have to see one of the most comfortable shoes I’ve bought and the arch support is perfect as well I have wide feet and these fit perfectly and not to narrow, even long runs or walks my feet don’t hurt or not sore and the padding in these Nike’s are very supportive!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Leon

customer_reviews.title: These she’s did not hold up at all.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes only a few months ago and they are already falling apart. They are starting to tear where my toes are, so soon my pinky toe will be sticking out of the shoe. Also, the air pocket part of the Air Max has unsealed. So when I walk, it is like stepping in a deflated pool float. Extremely disappointed since these were not cheap shoes.
customer_reviews.author: G from NY

customer_reviews.title: Caution! size women12 / men 9.5 is not Air Max Sequent 3
customer_reviews.text: it was a Nike Air Huarache size women12 / men 9.5 is wrong informaion it feel like men size about 10.5~11

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike anything about these shies. I'm a Barber and stand all day long and these shoes give me the support I need

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Runs *just* a little small. Certainly not to the point where you would consider moving up a size though. Very comfortable once broken in, with excellent cushioning.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and good seller
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I purchased them to wear to Disney World. Since I would be doing plenty of walking. They fit perfectly. The shoes were very comfortable. I got plenty of comments about the shoes. Good buy and great shipping on time.
customer_reviews.author: Billy McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really like the way the shoe looks, but it seems to be very narrow and the arch is on the wrong side (outside) of the shoe. The arch is so high on the outside of the shoe that it makes it very uncomfortable. I originally bought a 9.5 and thought it just may have been too small, but the 10 is a little too long, same width (too narrow) and same uncomfortable outside arch. Could be why they only cost right around $50.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not a very comfortable shoes for walking or running.
customer_reviews.text: The letters coding on the shoes was a little faded on the air cushion section. It's didn't really feel comfortable walking or running in them even though it's supposed to be designed for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Xknight

customer_reviews.title: Loose toebox.
customer_reviews.text: These are like wearing high heeled shoes. Liable to roll my ankle. Also, they are really loose around the toe. The back of the shoe is stiff and rugged, but the front is like a loose sock.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Initially uncomfortable but after a day, they are the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Has variations of white/cream throughout the shoe that gives it a bit of uniqueness. Very comfortable as well.

customer_reviews.title: The Worst, don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: First of all the shoe is tight in the center above the flat part of your foot causing cramping. The heel support on the sides are not there so your heel slips in word which is ridiculous. Easily the worst pair of shoes I’ve ever bought. Every negative review that’s on Amazon about this product is 100% true

customer_reviews.title: True to size narrow feet work best.
customer_reviews.text: They got delivered as promises on the original box, they are a little bit tight around the middle section of the sneakers hopefully they will loosen up as time goes by. I used them twice already and they look good hopefully they will last the test of time. So far I have no complaints.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fits good shoe size wise but are narrow and I fo not have wide feet. Very comfortable!

Super tight around the middle of the shoe/archway. Felt great day 1 but after 2 weeks of use causes me to walk funny and cause pain to my feet.

customer_reviews.title: If your a 9 buy 9.5.if you like tight fit then buy 8.5 and they will conform to size 9 shortly after

customer_reviews.title: No lateral support
customer_reviews.text: Put these on and within two steps I easily could have rolled my ankles. Fees like the bottoms are rounded. You couldn’t pay me to do any physical activity in these shoes. Back to under armour I go.

customer_reviews.text: These are the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever owned and I have no idea how to return them now because I don't want a different size; I want my money back. So sad. I really need shoes too. I literally have no shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Shoe fits too tight
customer_reviews.text: Overall the shoe is good looking, first pair of Nike shoes I’ve ever returned. They fit way too tight on the sides and caused pain and discomfort. For them being running shoes, they sure felt otherwise.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and super lightweight!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. Good arch support. Clean style. Excellent for running or x training. A little tight at first in toe region. But a little longer than a normal size ten. ???

customer_reviews.title: Shoes have dirt in the souls!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the shoes, it looks like they were worn there’s Dirt in the soles. I will be returning these shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Knock-offs?

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to start the day.  Not so much by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.text: I like the support of the shoe. However, as the foot swells throughout the day, the seam where the tongue and body of the shoe meet starts to irritate the top of my foot.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I love wearing them, they are so comfortable!

customer_reviews.text: Top of shoe had pressed into my foot until broke in. Afterward, they are some of my most comfortable shoes for everyday use.

customer_reviews.text: These hurt my husbands feet, especially in the toe and arch area! Stinks that we weren’t able to return because he had already worn them!

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for XFit.
customer_reviews.text: Use these for XFit 4days a week and they have been great. No issues with excessive wear or seams coming apart. Regular shoes just won’t cut it anymore for XFit. I’m spoiled.
